text.p: Winnipeg Commodity Exchange canola and grain futures pre-opening call as of 0830 CDT.

CANOLA - C$2.00 to C$4.00 a tonne up on firm CBOT soybean calls expected to prompt commercial and possibly fund short covering along with farmer hedges. July WCE futures crush margin rose to +7.40 Thursday from +3.15 Wednesday. Canada's dollar was lower at C$1.3819 versus the U.S. dollar, rose to 84.18 Japanese Yen and rose to 1.2304 German Marks.
FLAXSEED - Steady to C$0.50 a tonne up on allied markets.
WESTERN BARLEY - Steady to C$0.50 higher on higher CBOT corn calls with commercial selling seen above the market capping gains.
FEED WHEAT - C$0.20 to C$0.70 up on higher U.S. corn and wheat calls.
FEED PEAS - Steady to US$0.50 up on higher CBOT soymeal calls.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
